column4: Hi, I use debian squeeze. Is it possible to migrate to ubuntu changing the respository address
Can I add ubuntu respository on debian and change the system to ubuntu
debian isn't supported here, try #debian
Leonardo: you could but you'd get a huge mess possibly
Leonardo: I strongly advise a clean install with an md5 verified, cd verified ubuntu cd
But I would like to keep my programs and the config
Igoryonya: if you run; lsusb ,you can websearch for the 8 character hex id which will find more guides rather than constraining yourself to the laptop model
Leonardo: back the configs up. There is no garuntee they will work in ubuntu
Anon__; your OS isn't supported her
E
what are the ubuntu respository address
any page I can see
Leonardo: there are many
Leonardo: packages.ubuntu.com
Leonardo: each source server is a repo and they all rsync between each other. There isn't one ubuntu server. The update speed woould be painful
Weirdaar: sudo lshw -C display
I would like the address to be added on synaptic. I'll try to change from debian to ubuntu changing the repository adrress
Leonardo: I don't want any part of a fix if it can really really screw your system up
I want to try
Leonardo: there may be guides online but ots your call
*its
Weirdaar: my command will work on any linux system provided it has lshw available ;)
